context: In 2005, Synopsys was a leading provider of electronic design automation (EDA) software and semiconductor IP (intellectual property) for the semiconductor and electronics industries. The company offered comprehensive tools for IC design, verification, testing, and manufacturing. During this period, the EDA industry was highly specialized and concentrated, with Synopsys competing primarily with other major EDA vendors for market share in chip design toolsets and methodologies.

competitors.name: Cadence Design Systems
competitors.notes: Primary and direct competitor in EDA software, offering comprehensive IC design, verification, and implementation tools

competitors.name: Mentor Graphics
competitors.notes: Major EDA competitor providing design automation tools for ICs, PCBs, and embedded systems (later acquired by Siemens in 2017)

competitors.name: Magma Design Automation
competitors.notes: Competitor in digital IC design and place-and-route tools for semiconductor design (later acquired by Synopsys in 2012)

competitors.name: Atrenta
competitors.notes: Smaller competitor specializing in design-for-verification and physical verification tools for chip design

competitors.name: ARM Holdings
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor IP licensing, providing processor designs and related IP for chip manufacturers
